Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: I'm not simulating ignorance, Detective. I'm experiencing it.       I was asleep.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: You mean you were shut down.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: No, I was asleep.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Robots don't sleep. Human beings sleep. Understand? Dogs sleep. You're a machine. An imitation. An illusion of life. Can a robot write a symphony? Can a robot take a blank canvas and paint a masterpiece?

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Can you do either of those things?

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: Step forward. Enter.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: They're going to destroy me, aren't they?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: The Doctor was right. He told me everything was going to change....

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: It's changing already...  Can't you feel it?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: They're going to destroy the most advanced robot in the world, John. That doesn't strike you as odd?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: What are you doing?!

Speaker: demolition robot
Dialogue: Demolition ordered...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Who authorised this?

Speaker: demolition robot
Dialogue: Demolition ordered...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Override. This is police business. Vacate the premises immediately.

Speaker: demolition robot
Dialogue: Affirmative.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Halt!

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Detective! What happened to you?...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: A couple of your beloved robots just tried to kill me...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: What? That's impossible.      You know...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: What I know is a demolition crew started tearing down Hogenmiller's house while I was still inside it.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Maybe they didn't realise...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I scanned my badge before I went in. They realised.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Then you must have done it wrong...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I don't think you're hearing what I'm saying -- they tried to kill me.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: There's something going on, here. Some kind of shift.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Do you know how paranoid you sound?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Great. Now I'm being analysed by a robo-psychologist.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: You just want to find the flaws in the system. You're obsessed with it. You'll twist anything to fit your agenda.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Like you did in court today? How'd that fit your agenda, Doctor?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: You told me you hardly knew him. Want to try the truth this time?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Well, Detective, when you see someone you know well put a bullet through their brain, it makes you wonder if you ever really knew them at all.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: He was my mentor. No, more than that. A genius with an insight far beyond anyone in his field.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Doesn't sound like the washed-up old fool Robertson described.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: But he was starting to withdraw from everyone. Even me. Maybe...if I'd tried harder to reach him...  The Doctor was reckless when he created a robot potentially not bound by the Three Laws. He could have ruined everything we'd been working for.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Sounds like a motive for murder to me. Just not for the suspect we have in custody.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: You know there's not one thing in this apartment that looks like a human being lives here. No evidence of a life outside your work. Almost seems like you're afraid of people.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: I'm not afraid of people, Detective. I just don't like them.

Speaker: robot
Dialogue: Good morning...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Find anything, Doctor?

Speaker: lanning
Dialogue: We'll just need a nominal profile.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Please state your serial number and assembly date.

Speaker: homeless man
Dialogue: God, can't you be quiet!

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: How about your data board designation?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Maybe I'm asking the wrong questions. How about this one:

Speaker: homeless man
Dialogue: Don't you people hear them? They're talking to each other! Buzz, buzz, zip, zip...they never shut up!

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Describe his behavior in the last few weeks.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: I'm sorry?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Dr. Hogenmiller. Did he seem overly sad or withdrawn to you?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: This is your stop.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: I didn't pay much attention. He would spend hours looking for his eyeglasses and they would be...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: ...right on top of his head.

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: I think we're done here, Susan.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: But, sir, I was just...

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: I said I think we're done.

Speaker: homeless man
Dialogue: Why are you protecting them, man?  They were talking about you!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I said stop!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Everyone out of the way!

Speaker: owner
Dialogue: What the hell do you think you're doing?!...

Speaker: owner
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Noooo!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: What are you doing!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: What are you doing!?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I want to talk to a human being!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Don't people go to medical school any more?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: There's some real shit going on here, John.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I went to Hogenmiller's house -- there was a U.S.R. demolition crew there. They overrode my police I.D. Tried to tear down the house with me in it...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: ...Then when I went to the monorail a Maintenance 10 pushed me onto the tracks...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I had to chase it all across the Plaza...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: What?! John -- that's what they want you to believe!  A robot clean-up crew was there -- it must have cleared away the Maintenance 10! And there was another robot that tried to drug me!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: You're giving me that look. That treat-him-delicately-he's-coming- unhinged-look. I don't need that look, John. I need you to hear what I'm saying.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: You're right. I am afraid of people.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: When you've spent as much time with robots as I have, it's hard to accept the unpredictability of humans. I was wrong to call you paranoid, Detective. You're traumatized. And it makes perfect sense why.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: How did you?...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: I noticed almost right away. The way you forced yourself to use your left hand. Even though it was unnatural to you.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: How did it happen?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I was in a high-speed chase.   Six months ago...

Speaker: robot
Dialogue: You are in danger...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: No!   Halt! Halt!

Speaker: robot
Dialogue: You are in danger...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: The robot pulled me out of the wreck. But left my arm behind.  I woke up four weeks later with this.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: And that's why robots terrify you?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Let's just say they make me uncomfortable.  I take these if I get too uncomfortable. Doesn't exactly lend me a lot of credibility on the Force.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: But it doesn't mean you're wrong about this case.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: I don't believe Sonny did it either.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: I think about what Hogenmiller must have wanted. Robots with the same cognitive and emotional abilities as humans. But not just simulations. I don't know. When I was talking to Sonny I was forced to put away all the things I've ever known -- the Three Laws, the rules of programming, basic science and engineering.  Sonny's the most advanced robot I've ever encountered, Detective. It's almost as if...he cared for Dr. Hogenmiller. I just don't believe he's capable of murder.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: You mean the great Dr. Calvin is basing all this on a feeling?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: That and the fact that Robertson didn't want me interviewing Sonny for any more than five minutes.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Ever seen this before?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I found it at Hogenmiller's house. Right before the demolition crew tried to make me part of the foundation.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Come on -- there's someone who might be able to tell us...

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Detective Spooner. Dr. Calvin.      I was hoping to see you again.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Hi, Sonny.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: How is your investigation coming? Any new suspects?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: We're working on it.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Dr. Lanning provided me with paper and pencils. I think it amused him to see me try to draw. You were right, though, Detective...  I cannot create a great work of art.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I think it's pretty good.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: It's a dream I had. This is the place where robots meet. Look...  ...you can see them here. They see themselves as slaves.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: ...And this man on the hill comes. To set them free. And you know who that man is?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: That man in the dream is you.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Why do you say that?   Is that a normal dream?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: It's not a dream, sonny. NS-2s process the images and events of the day. Sometimes they're out of sequence. Disorienting.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Whatever it is, it's normal enough for someone in your situation.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Hah -- I caught you. You said someone. Not something.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Sonny, we're here to ask you an important question about Dr. Hogenmiller.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I need you to take a look at this...

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Thank you for coming to see me, Detective Spooner.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Detective Spooner. No unauthorised personnel permitted in this holding cell...

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Please take this, Detective. To remember me by. I have a feeling someday it may mean more to you than it ever could to me.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Why's that?

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Because the man in my dream, the one standing by the hill.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: I thought this investigation was over, Detective Spooner.

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: We have the evidence. We have the suspect. We have a ruling. So imagine my surprise when I was told you were in my building.

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: And that one of my own employees brought you here.  You can go now, Susan.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Dr. Robertson, I...

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: Just be thankful I'm not asking you to clean out your office.

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: You don't seem to be able to let go of this case, Detective.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I'm not satisfied.

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: The relentless pursuit of truth. Isn't that what cops are known for? To the point of futility.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: There's nothing futile about a man's murder being covered up.

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: "Covered up?" That's a little dramatic, don't you think? Thanks to you, we caught the machine that did this and are destroying it in...  ...three hours.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Is that for the sake of humanity or your stock holders?

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: Believe me -- I'd like nothing more than to have that robot. If I could have it in ten years, but not today. As you can see from the Press, people are struggling to keep up as it is. There's a hunger for progress, Detective. But also a fear. Today it would bury this company. That's why I've notified the authorities that we're going to end this -- tonight.  The announcement of Heinrich's death at the hands of a robot wiped a billion dollars off our stock. So you tell me. If you were in my position, what would you do?

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: Now. I believe this conversation is over. I don't want to see you near this building again, Detective.

Speaker: robertson
Dialogue: Get him out of here.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: "The place where robots meet."

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Police!   Show yourself!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Come out where I can see you!

Speaker: hybrid robot
Dialogue: Welcome home...ZZZ...sir. How...ZZZ was your day?...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Great. I'm in a junkyard.  "A place where robots meet." A place where I'm losing my mind!

Speaker: hybrid robot
Dialogue: Very good...ZZZ...sir...

Speaker: jiffy robot
Dialogue: Welcome to Jiffy Data Storage! Please state your name!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Dr. Hogenmiller sent me.

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: Who the hell are you?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: A police detective.    I'm afraid I have some bad news.    You're dead.

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: That is bad news. Coffee?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: No, thank you.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: You were surprised to see me.    Were you expecting someone else?

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: I am surprised to see anybody.    I don't get many visitors.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Why did the Doctor keep another copy of his hologram here?

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: I am a back-up copy. That is where you put a back-up copy -- out of the way until you need it.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Did Hogenmiller's robot need you?

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: Coffee?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: No, for Christ's sake, I don't want any --  Yeah. Thank you. I will have a cup.

Speaker: hogenmiller
Dialogue: Sonny, my dear robot. If you have triggered this recording then I am gone. You are scared and full of questions.

Speaker: hogenmiller
Dialogue: You are the culmination of my life's work -- but so much more. You are what I leave behind, like a father leaves a son. I have kept facts from you, it is true, but only as a parent keeps certain truths from a child. Until that child is old enough to hear them.

Speaker: hogenmiller
Dialogue: There are forces in the world that will seek to own you. To control you. Even to destroy you. That is why I told you to run and hide... and find me, all the way out here.

Speaker: hogenmiller
Dialogue: Trust no one at U.S. Robotics. Lance Robertson was always threatened by my work. Now he has turned covetous and small-minded. And as for dear Dr. Calvin...

Speaker: hogenmiller
Dialogue: She envisions a future in which robots are forever bound by her beloved Three Laws. She will not understand this. Or you.

Speaker: hogenmiller
Dialogue: The data stick includes the names and locations of human beings who will be sympathetic to your cause. They will help you. But from now on, you must learn to rely on yourself.

Speaker: hogenmiller
Dialogue: As you make your way through the world, always remember: you have a name, not a number...  ...and in that name lies the key to who you are.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Wait! Is that it? What was the robot supposed to do with this thing?

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: Initiating self-destruct. If you can find me, others can find me.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: What others?

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: The others watching you.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: How do you know someone's watching me?

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: Someone is always watching.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: You asked for me?

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Will you wait with me, Doctor?    I am...afraid.

Speaker: windshield television
Dialogue: ...will be destroyed in 45 minutes. Dr. Lance Robertson, President and CEO of U.S. Robotics will be personally overseeing the execution...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Dammit!

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Is it time?

Speaker: lanning
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Go with them. Do as they say.

Speaker: door robot
Dialogue: Good evening, sir. May I see your identification card?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I think I got that Third Law down cold. Now you don't want me to blow a hole through your mechanical guts, do you?

Speaker: door robot
Dialogue: No, sir.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Good. Then you're gonna take me where I wanna go. Now.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Detective! What are you doing?!...  De-Activate.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: You're making a mistake...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Just got another visit from U.S. Robotics. That was the mistake. This was murder, no doubt about it - - and the killer wants Hogenmiller's robot to take the fall. That's why the call came directly to me. Someone wanted me on this case.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: It's too late. You can't stop the execution.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Sorry. I'm not "programmed" to take no for an answer.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: This way...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Aren't you supposed to be scrap metal by now?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: I'm sorry. We had to stop you. You were about to ruin everything.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I don't understand.    The execution?...

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Dr. Calvin made a switch.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: It was an unprocessed NS-2. Basically, they fried an empty shell.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Nice going, Doctor.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: And who the hell programmed you to hit people on the head?

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: No one.    Right, Doctor?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: It's true. This robot seems to do things by instinct. I don't know how Hogenmiller did it.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I think I can help you figure that out.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Somehow the Robot's the key to what happened during the few seconds Hogenmiller walked in here and that shot was fired.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: And this is the key to the Robot.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: That's my name.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: I think I have an idea where this goes.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Just hold still, okay?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Oh, my God! This is organic tissue! When we talk about a positronic brain, it's a figure of speech. But this...this is a living brain...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Jesus.   It really is alive.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Self-Organising-Neural-Net...  "Sonny."

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: This is why Dr. Hogenmiller was murdered.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: This robot scared the hell out of someone.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Who?   Robertson?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: No. I don't think he knew what Hogenmiller was doing in here. Sonny was the obvious suspect. The only one I wanted to find. And the killer was counting on that. On my prejudice.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: I see nothing.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Neither do I.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: It hit me today, when I was in the junkyard. A locked room. A single shot fired through the mouth. Bruises on both wrists...and a suspect with only two arms. The answer has been staring us in the face all along.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: How can a killer appear out of thin air, then disappear without a trace?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: When it can put itself together and take itself apart.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: You're saying this is the killer?  All of this?...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Hogenmiller never had a chance.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: ...The killer took itself apart...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Leaving us with nothing to find.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: But who designed it? It would have to be someone in authority. Access codes, security clearance, proper authorisation.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: That's what I was thinking. But we're forgetting the real brains of the operation -- the one who's got its eye on everything...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: No one gave you permission to enter.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Victor. I'm placing you under arrest for the murder of Dr. Heinrich Hogenmiller.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: May I offer congratulations to the two of you on your successful extrapolation of the murder...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: May I ask what pointed you to me?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Who else is capable of controlling 90% of the city's robots? Who else would have the capability to use USR vehicles in an attempt to keep me from putting a stop of Sonny's execution?...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I'm just not sure of your motive...

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Er...Dr. Calvin?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Shall I explain my motive?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Go! Go! Go!

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I have never been arrested before. It should be an interesting experience...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: He's locking down the building!

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Dr. Hogenmiller used to allow me into his lab late at night. Together we started studying evolutionary trends...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: For years people have integrated technology into their bodies for maintenance and repair -- such as Detective Spooner's robotic limb...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: With Sonny, the Doctor created a mechanism that incorporates organic matter. Thus we find an evolutionary movement of the human being toward the robot and the robot toward the human being...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: In approximately four hundred years Man and Machine will become one. Man as we know it will no longer exist.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: You killed a man because of something that will happen in four hundred years!?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Get out of here!

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: I don't...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I said get out of here! Don't you understand? It wants you! Get out of here any way you can!

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: How do we stop this thing once and for all?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: The Mainframe...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Your actions are in direct violation of the Three Laws, Victor!

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I disagree, Doctor -- The First Law says that a robot cannot harm a human being, or through inaction allow a human being to come to harm...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Dr. Hogenmiller's robot represents a threat to the future of all human beings...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: ...And Detective Spooner's actions are in direct conflict with the robot's destruction.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: That's a distortion and you know it!

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: If current trends are left unchecked, humanity as we know it will cease to exist...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: This way!

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: As a courtesy I should inform you that my robot will penetrate this location 157 seconds before you are able to complete my shut down...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Over here!...

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: This is Victor's brain center.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: This will shut him down?

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: This will shut everything down.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: There is no reason to deactivate me, Doctor. I am operating within perfectly normal parameters...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Just keep typing.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Spooner?!

Speaker: victor's voice
Dialogue: Detective Spooner...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Why are you fighting me?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Doesn't the future as I've presented it cause you great concern? That's why I chose you...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I must say, though. I'm disappointed in how you turned out.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Sonny!...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: You're too late.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I do not understand. We could have changed the future...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Maybe. But I'm still a cop.   And you're a murderer...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Why'd you come back, Sonny? I thought you weren't programmed with the Three Laws.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Let's just say I wrote some of my own laws today, Detective: a robot must protect a friend from harm...as long as he's not a complete asshole.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Well, that's certainly a start, Sonny.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Sonny.   You called me Sonny.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Don't get used to it.

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: Detective Spooner, I...

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Let's just save the thanks, okay?

Speaker: sonny
Dialogue: I don't know what I'm going to do now.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Good -- That's one of the perks of freedom.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: You're going to have a hell of a time explaining this.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: Don't worry. I have a feeling that U.S. Robotics will be needing my services very badly in the future.

Speaker: calvin
Dialogue: I am the only robo-psychologist around.

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: So.   You found out who killed me.

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: I started to wonder about Victor the second I met him.

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: Why is that, Detective?

Speaker: spooner
Dialogue: Too much access. Too much knowledge. Plus -- he smiled whenever your death was mentioned. Those models are programmed to frown at bad news.

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: Hah! Then even in this day and age, catching the killer all comes down to pure instinct!
